post_content_localized.en:
Have you heard that Manhattan’s West Side has a brand new neighborhood? The spanking new corner of New York is called Hudson Yards. Here’s everything you need to know about this waterfront neighborhood before you venture out to explore it.

Hudson Yards in a Nutshell

Located between 10th and 12th Avenues from West 30th to West 34th Street, Hudson Yards, like Hell’s Kitchen and Chelsea, went from a forgotten industrial patch of land to a sleek and chic space coveted by the city’s major brands. You’ll find culinary masterpieces, world-renowned brands, public parks and art exhibitions spanning over 14 acres!

Main Attractions

Don’t make the mistake of thinking about Hudson Yards as just another fancy mall, though. It’s central structure is the Vessel, a spiral staircase with 154 flights of stairs and 80 landings. This futuristic landmark overlooks the Hudson River and offers stunning views of the city. In fact, the Vessel is by far the most photographed area of Hudson Yards. To visit it, you need to book free tickets in advance or snag a few same-day tickets.

If you want more skyline views, climb to the Edge, “the highest man-made outdoor viewing area in the western hemisphere.” That’s something worth seeing!

Art buffs should head straight to Snark Park and The Shed. Both locations were turned into art galleries featuring modern installations and forward-thinking artwork across multiple disciplines.

Shopping

As we said earlier, Hudson Yards is home to luxury brands. Shopaholics will drawl over the vast selection of stores, covering everything from women’s, men’s, children’s, shoes, jewellry, home, electronics, and much more.

Dining

New Yorkers love good food and Hudson Yards delivers. You’ll find 25 restaurants serving some of the best food in the city, and, arguably, the world. The variety of cuisines is impressive and we’re sure even the most demanding palates will come across something new.

In addition to top restaurants, Hudson Yards has cafes, bars, fast food, casual eateries and even food markets!

Are you excited to see for yourself why this new neighborhood has captured the attention of the entire world? Next time you’re visiting your New York home, go out and discover Hudson Yards!
